intro: Bertya tasmanica subsp. vestita, commonly known as the Tasmanian Bertya, is a flowering plant native to Tasmania. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its evergreen shrub form. The plant features small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white in color. Its leaves are leathery and glossy, with a waxy coating that helps it retain moisture in its natural habitat. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in heathlands and rocky areas.
